elements.title: Schlosspark Biebrich (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Schlosspark Biebrich (pictured), the garden at a former residence of the Duchy of Nassau on the Rhine, is the venue of the Internationales Pfingstturnier Wiesbaden?

elements.title: Eric Berger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eric Berger wrote about weather for the Houston Chronicle even before he became a certified meteorologist?

elements.title: detained as political prisoners (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Poles who fought in the Russian Partition during the January Uprising were detained as political prisoners in Magdeburg and Graudenz, Prussia, even though the uprising never crossed the border?

elements.title: Haripriya Banoth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Haripriya Banoth is the youngest member of the Telangana Legislative Assembly?

elements.title: All-New Halloween Spooktacular! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elizabeth Olsen and Paul Bettany wore comic-book-accurate Scarlet Witch and Vision Halloween costumes in the WandaVision episode "All-New Halloween Spooktacular!"?

elements.title: Cambridge Greek Lexicon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that research for the Cambridge Greek Lexicon was planned to last five years but was only completed after twenty-three?

elements.title: Digging the Grave (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Faith No More's "Digging the Grave" was featured on both Beavis and Butt-Head and Top of the Pops?

elements.title: Lydia Wevers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lydia Wevers was the first scholar to write about the history of short stories in New Zealand?
